description: Stray Holly (pictured) - found on the streets of Swansea - had to have a cancerous tumour removed from behind her ear before it caused her serious health issues. She lost a lot of her head.
title: The cat with half a head! Holly left short up top after tumour op
title_page: The cat with half a head! Holly left short up top after tumour op | Daily Mail Online
text:
Stray Holly had to have a cancerous tumour removed from behind her ear before it caused her serious health issues
We've all heard about cats having nine lives - but have you heard the tale of the feline with just half a head?
Stray Holly had to have a cancerous tumour removed from behind her ear before it caused her serious health issues.
The friendly moggie went under the knife earlier this month, surviving what vets described as a successful operation.
But in doing so, it meant she lost the bulk of her skull - leaving her with just half of the head she had before.
Greg Weeks is manager of the Llys Nini Animal Centre in Swansea, South Wales, which cared for the owner-less stray.
He said: 'Holly came into the centre as a stray at the beginning of the month.
'She had cancer of the ear which has now been all sorted.
'She was not in the best of conditions on arrival and we have reason to believe that she is also deaf.'
The black and white puss is thought to be around 11-years-old.
When she was found she was in a bad way. Her fur was matted, she had an ear infection and scabs all over her face.
But she is now back on her feet - albeit a little bit lighter up top.
Greg and his team are hopeful that they will now be able to find their fixed-up furry friend a loving new home.
The friendly moggie went under the knife earlier this month, surviving what vets described as a successful operation
But in doing so, it meant she lost the bulk of her skull - leaving her with just half of the head she had before
Greg and his team are hopeful that they will now be able to find their fixed-up furry friend a loving new home
'She is a lovely little cat, and I'm sure there is someone out there who would want to have her,' Greg said.
'Despite what she has been through with the treatment of her cancer and her long term stay at the vets, she has a very sweet nature.
